issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://youtube.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fyoutube.com) ### Comment > YouTube is playing ads, and AdGuard Pro is not blocking them (except possibly mid-roll ads). This has been going on for over a week, despite updates, restarting, rebooting, etc. Does not seem to happen on my phone, only my iPad Pro. Please help! Thank you! ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/7s5tw2xbil4wo0owokwocgo44o0s4okh2km6a5cli8.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.14 (1040) System version: | `iPadOS 26` License type: | paid Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | server: `AdGuard DNS`
Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base Other extensions used: | `None`

comment.body:
@Alex-302 
> Still cannot start stream. I have an IP cam. Can be RTSP stream used here?

I think it is possible to use it as RTSP, but I believe it will be difficult to reference it directly from the YouTube Live browser dashboard. (I think you will need to relay it with a software encoder.)

ref: Create a YouTube live stream with an encoder - YouTube Help
[https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/2907883](https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/2907883)

There are countless websites that explain how to stream on YouTube Live, so please search in your own language.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

### Issue URL (Ads) [https://onedio.com/haber/zam-yapilmayacak-bazi-memurlara-kotu-haber-tartismalara-neden-olan-30-bin-tl-memur-zammi-iptal-oldu-1329487](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fonedio.com%2Fhaber%2Fzam-yapilmayacak-bazi-memurlara-kotu-haber-tartismalara-neden-olan-30-bin-tl-memur-zammi-iptal-oldu-1329487) ### Comment > As seen in the videos, the current Adguard filter > `onedio.com#?#.layout__main div.bg-\[\#f7f8fb\]:has(div:contains(Reklam))` > loads the div section containing the advertisement for a short time when the page opens and then hides it. comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

The `onedio.com##.article__oads` filter, instead of the current one, ensures the page loads much cleaner. > > `https://streamable.com/i3i7j5` > `https://streamable.com/0uu0wv` ``` Username: @punisher018 ``` ### Screenshots

comment.body:
>AdGuard stopped blocking ads in Chrome today.
It still works in Edge without the browser extension.

Probably related to - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardForWindows/issues/5771
Please try to enable `WFP` driver in `AdGuard` -> `Settings` -> `Network`

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

AdGuard for iOS ### AdGuard version 4.5.14(1040) ### What type of problem have you encountered? Website or app doesn't work properly ### Which browser(s) do you use? Firefox ### Which device do you use? Mobile ### Where is the problem encountered? https://pay.emag.bg ### Ad Blocking AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter ### Privacy AdGuard Tracking Protection filter ### Social Widgets _No response_ ### Annoyances _No response_ ### Security _No response_ ### Other _No response_ ### DNS filters _No response_ ### Language-specific Bulgarian list ### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled? _No response_ ### Add your comment and screenshots 1. When making an order on emag.bg from the app, when I go to continue with payment, the app opens modal to the domain pay.emag.bg. Opening directly pay.emag.bg in browser on phone it results in it being blocked, but when I disable AdGuard, it goes to https://romania.payu.com/ just fine. 2. Screenshot

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/217361#issuecomment-3543254083
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/217361#issuecomment-3543292705
not reproduced on my end.
Try to update the filters (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 7 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://abema.tv/video/episode/19-86_s1_p19](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fabema.tv%2Fvideo%2Fepisode%2F19-86_s1_p19) ### Comment > Cannot play videos on [abema.tv] when the AdGuard popup filter is enabled > > > Details: > When the AdGuard browser extension is disabled, the site displays a popup survey to the user. When the AdGuard popup filter is enabled, the popup survey is successfully blocked, but the video fails to play. > > Since the behavior changes depending on whether the AdGuard popup filter is ON or OFF, I suspect this filter is causing the issue. > > Target URL: > https://abema.tv/video/episode/19-86_s1_p19 > > Note: The same issue occurs with videos other than this specific URL as well. ``` Username: @okotowarishimasu ``` ### Screenshots

issue.title: google.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.google.co.jp/index.html?zx=1763826810772&no_sw_cr=1](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.co.jp%2Findex.html%3Fzx%3D1763826810772%26no_sw_cr%3D1) ### Comment > I would like to report an issue I’ve noticed with AdGuard DNS filtering. However, I wasn’t sure where I should submit the report, so I ended up posting it on an unrelated website. I apologize for that. > The issue is that the battery consumption of DNS filtering suddenly increased. For example, in the past ten days, its background battery usage had consistently been below 1%, but today it unexpectedly rose to around 40%. Although I understand there can be some fluctuation, it has typically been no more than around 5%. That is why I decided to report the issue. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/j60pgi55fbc40wok8ks4wks8owck04khh6uvs1g40o.png?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/gjcwacvvyn4g8wcgck0g48s00gwcssc78tc4j8htz8.png?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.14 System version: | `iOS18.7.2` License type: | paid Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | server: `System default`
filters: `https://filters.adtidy.org/ios/filters/15_optimized.txt` Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base

Other:
AdGuard DNS

For example, in the past ten days, its background battery usage had consistently been below 1%, but today it unexpectedly rose to around 40%. Although I understand there can be some fluctuation, it has typically been no more than around 5%. That is why I decided to report the issue. ### Screenshots

issue.title: abema.tv
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://abema.tv/video/episode/19-86_s1_p19](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fabema.tv%2Fvideo%2Fepisode%2F19-86_s1_p19) ### Comment > Cannot play videos on [abema.tv] when the AdGuard popup filter is enabled > > > Details: > When the AdGuard browser extension is disabled, the site displays a popup survey to the user. When the AdGuard popup filter is enabled, the popup survey is successfully blocked, but the video fails to play. > > Since the behavior changes depending on whether the AdGuard popup filter is ON or OFF, I suspect this filter is causing the issue. > > Target URL: > https://abema.tv/video/episode/19-86_s1_p19 > > Note: The same issue occurs with videos other than this specific URL as well. ``` Username: @okotowarishimasu ``` ### Screenshots
